One thing I forgot to say on this thread was that it occured to me
just now that you can solve the boxes domain without multiplication.
The obvious and ideal solution is to map connection length (euclidean
distance) to connection weight, hence the need for multiplication and
comparison. An alternative solution is manhattan distance/length, so
instead of the connections forming circular/radial patterns around the
switched-on pixels (the boxes) you get a diamond shape (a square
rotated 45 degrees to the boxes), and this should be good enough to
solve the domain perfectly with just addition and subtraction,
because:

x_delta = x1-x2
y_delta = y1-y2

Manhattan distance = abs(x_delta) + abs(y_delta)
Euclidean distance = sqrt(x_delta^2 + y_delta^2)

So the domain should be easier to solve than I initally thought.
